sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词都表示"揭露，暴露"之意。
means: disclose ： 侧重指揭露或泄露鲜为人知或保密的事。
expose ： 多指揭露丑闻、坏人坏事或各种阴谋。也可指某物暴露在外。
uncover ： 主要指移去遮盖物，让东西显露出来。也可指揭露阴谋、秘密等。
reveal ： 多指揭露一直隐藏或隐秘的东西，或启示超乎常人领导能力的真理。

sentence.Network_en: When Myra told Karp she'd expose his past, he blew up.
sentence.Network_cn: 当迈拉告诉卡普她会把他的过去全抖搂出去时，卡普大为光火。

sentence.Network_en: The Budget does expose the lies ministers were telling a year ago.
sentence.Network_cn: 预算案无疑揭穿了部长们一年前所说的谎话。

sentence.Network_en: She threatened to publicly expose his double life if he left her.
sentence.Network_cn: 她威胁说如果他离开她，她就将他双重人格的生活方式公之于众。

翻译，共同学习！！_百度知道 ... 8. out of fear 基于害怕心理 ， 出于恐惧 1. expose to 使易受, 使受 3. to 是介词.

entry.def: To expose something that is usually hidden means to uncover it so that it can be seen.

example.ex: Lowered sea levels exposed the shallow continental shelf beneath the Bering Sea...
example.tran: 海平面下降使白令海底部的浅层大陆架暴露出来。

example.ex: For an instant his whole back was exposed.
example.tran: 一瞬间，他整个背部都露了出来。

entry.def: To expose a person or situation means to reveal that they are bad or immoral in some way.

example.ex: The Budget does expose the lies ministers were telling a year ago...
example.tran: 预算案无疑揭穿了部长们一年前所说的谎话。

example.ex: After the scandal was exposed, Dr Bailey committed suicide...
example.tran: 丑闻曝光后，贝利博士自杀了。

entry.tran: 使暴露于（险境）;使遭受（危险或不快）
entry.def: If someone is exposed to something dangerous or unpleasant, they are put in a situation in which it might affect them.

example.ex: They had not been exposed to most diseases common to urban populations...
example.tran: 城市人口中多数常见的疾病他们都没有接触到。

example.ex: A wise mother never exposes her children to the slightest possibility of danger.
example.tran: 明智的母亲决不会让她的孩子置身于一丁点儿危险之中。

entry.tran: 使受…的影响(或熏陶);使接触
entry.def: If someone is exposed to an idea or feeling, usually a new one, they are given experience of it, or introduced to it.

example.ex: ...local people who've not been exposed to glimpses of Western life before...
example.tran: 过去丝毫未曾见识过西方生活的当地人

example.ex: These units exposed children to many viewpoints of a given issue.
example.tran: 这些单元让孩子们接触到有关某一特定问题的多种观点。

entry.tran: （常因精神或感情失控）暴露性器官，当众露阴
entry.def: A man who exposes himself shows people his genitals in a public place, usually because he is mentally or emotionally disturbed.

example.ex: Smith admitted indecently exposing himself on Wimbledon Common.
example.tran: 史密斯承认自己在温布尔登公地当众露阴，有伤风化。

means.word_mean: 1. the exposure of an impostor or a fraud;

sentences.sentence: "he published an expose of the graft and corruption in city government"

means.word_mean: 1. expose or make accessible to some action or influence;
2. make known to the public information that was previously known only to a few people or that was meant to be kept a secret;

sentences.sentence: "The auction house would not disclose the price at which the van Gogh had sold"
"The actress won't reveal how old she is"

means.word_mean: 3. to show, make visible or apparent;

sentences.sentence: "The Metropolitan Museum is exhibiting Goya's works this month"
"Why don't you show your nice legs and wear shorter skirts?"
"National leaders will have to display the highest skills of statesmanship"

means.word_mean: 4. remove all or part of one's clothes to show one's body;

sentences.sentence: "The man exposed himself in the subway"

means.word_mean: 5. disclose to view as by removing a cover;

sentences.sentence: "The curtain rose to disclose a stunning set"

means.word_mean: 6. put in a dangerous, disadvantageous, or difficult position
7. expose to light, of photographic film
8. expose while ridiculing; especially of pretentious or false claims and ideas;
9. abandon by leaving out in the open air;

sentences.sentence: "The infant was exposed by the teenage mother"

stems_affixes.word_buile: dispose安排+ed……的→任安排的→心甘情愿的
in不+disposed[adj.愿意的,想干的]→adj.不愿意的,身体不适的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 作家, 作曲家, 设计者, 著作者
stems_affixes.word_buile: compose创作+er人→composer作家, 作曲家
pose放→n.姿势,姿态 v.造成,提出,摆姿势,佯装
propose[v.计划, 建议, 向……提议, 求[婚] v.打算, 求婚]+al表名词→n.提议,建议;求婚

stems_affixes.value_cn: 组成,构成;[of]由…组成;创作[诗歌等]

stems_affixes.word_buile: pose放→n.姿势,姿态 v.造成,提出,摆姿势,佯装

stems_affixes.value_cn: 计划, 建议, 向……提议, 求[婚]
调换, 颠倒顺序, 移项

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表示"出,出去"; 2. 表示"前面的,前任的"

stems_affixes.word_buile: ex出,出去+orbit圆圈,轨道+ant……的→出轨的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 详述的,明确的;坦率的;显然的
stems_affixes.word_buile: ex出,出去+pli重叠+cit→把重叠的东西弄出
ex出,出去+port港口→出港口→出口
ex出,出去+port港口→出港口→出口

stems_affixes.value_cn: 交换, 调换, 兑换, 交流, 交易
stems_affixes.word_buile: ex出,出去+change改变,兑换→变换出去→交换, 调换
ex出,出去+pand扩散→v. 扩张;张开, 发展
ex出,出去+purg纯洁,冲洗+ate做→冲洗出来→净化
ex出,出去+clud关闭+e→关出去→排外

kd.ZH: 将...暴露在...之下，使...处于...影响下

Sentence.sentence: Bad management techniques will be exposed.
She insists that it's exposing workers to unnecessarily high doses of radiation.
It exposes him to oily smoke all day long.
I'm afraid to refuse to work, but I'm more afraid to expose my unborn child to the radiation.
The Internet] exposes them to more thinking," he says, "and groups that are like-minded in different parts of the country start to come together.

means.word_mean: 使遭受(嘲讽等)，被公开斥责或嘲笑为(错误、愚蠢、愚笨的行为或人等)

sentences.en: Her foolish actions exposed her to ridicule.
sentences.cn: 她的愚蠢行为贻笑大方。

means.word_mean: 遗弃(婴儿等)于户外(或无遮蔽处)

sentences.en: Some ancient people exposed unwanted infants.
sentences.cn: 某些古代民族遗弃不需要的婴儿。

jushi.english: She exposed her unwanted baby by the roadside.
jushi.chinese: 她将不想要的婴儿丢弃在路边。

jushi.english: New fashions are exposing more and more the body.
